00001 --=============================================================================
00002 --! @file settings.vhd
00003 --! @brief Settings generator
00004 --=============================================================================
00005 --! Standard library
00006 library IEEE;
00007 --! Standard packages
00008 use IEEE.STD_LOGIC_1164.all; --! std_logic definitions
00009 use IEEE.NUMERIC_STD.all;    --! conversion functions
00010 
00011 
00012 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00013 --                                                                           --
00014 --                                  settings                                 --
00015 --                                                                           --
00016 --                               CERN, BE/CO/HT                              --
00017 --                                                                           --
00018 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00019 --
00020 -- unit name: settings
00021 --
00022 --! @brief Settings generator.
00023 --!
00024 --! Used in the NanoFIP design. \n
00025 --! The Settings unit generates the constants used inside the design.
00026 --! Some inputs are directly taken over from the input pins as they don't need
00027 --! any treatment.
00028 --!
00029 --! SEE mitigation techniques used:
00030 --! - mostly combinatiorial logic \n
00031 --! - registered constructor and model id regenerated on request \n
00032 --! 
00033 --! @author Erik van der Bij (Erik.van.der.Bij@cern.ch)
00034 --
00035 --! @date 10/07/2009
00036 --
00037 --! @version v0.01
00038 --
00039 --! @details 
00040 --!
00041 --! <b>Dependencies:</b>\n
00042 --! none                \n
00043 --!
00044 --! <b>References:</b>\n
00045 --! 
00046 --! 
00047 --!
00048 --! <b>Modified by:</b>\n
00049 --! Erik van der Bij
00050 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 --! \n\n<b>Last changes:</b>\n
00052 --! 10/07/2009  v0.01  EB  First version \n
00053 --!
00054 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00055 --! @todo Create testbench and simulate \n
00056 --!
00057 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00058 
00059 
00060 --=============================================================================
00061 --! Entity declaration for settings
00062 --=============================================================================
00063 entity settings is
00064 
00065 port (
00066 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00067 --  General connections
00068 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00069    clk       : in  std_logic; --! Clock used for generating id's
00070 
00071 
00072 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00073 --  Connections to pins of the NanoFIP
00074 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00075 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076 -- WorldFIP settings
00077 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078       --! Bit rate         \n
00079       --! 00: 31.25 kbit/s \n
00080       --! 01: 1 Mbit/s     \n
00081       --! 10: 2.5 Mbit/s   \n
00082       --! 11: reserved, do not use
00083    rate_i    : in  std_logic_vector (1 downto 0); --! Bit rate
00084 
00085       --! Subscriber number coding. Station address.
00086    subs_i    : in  std_logic_vector (7 downto 0); --! Subscriber number coding.
00087 
00088       --! Identification selection (see M_ID, C_ID)
00089    s_id_o    : out std_logic_vector (1 downto 0); --! Identification selection
00090 
00091       --! Identification variable settings. 
00092       --! Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to 
00093       --! obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).\n
00094       --! M_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc               \n
00095       --! Model [2*i]            0    1    0    1                \n
00096       --! Model [2*i+1]          0    0    1    1
00097    m_id_i    : in  std_logic_vector (3 downto 0); --! Model identification settings
00098 
00099       --! Identification variable settings.
00100       --! Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to 
00101       --! obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).\n
00102       --! C_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc               \n
00103       --! Constructor[2*i]       0    1    0    1                \n
00104       --! Constructor[2*i+1]     0    0    1    1
00105    c_id_i    : in  std_logic_vector (3 downto 0); --! Constructor identification settings
00106 
00107       --! Produced variable data length \n
00108       --! 000: 2 Bytes                  \n
00109       --! 001: 8 Bytes                  \n
00110       --! 010: 16 Bytes                 \n
00111       --! 011: 32 Bytes                 \n
00112       --! 100: 64 Bytes                 \n
00113       --! 101: 124 Bytes                \n
00114       --! 110: reserved, do not use     \n
00115       --! 111: reserved, do not use     \n
00116       --! Actual size: +1 NanoFIP Status byte +1 MPS Status byte (last transmitted) 
00117       --! Note: when SLONE=Vcc, p3_lgth_i should be set to 000.
00118    p3_lgth_i : in  std_logic_vector (2 downto 0); --! Produced variable data length
00119 
00120       --! Stand-alone mode
00121       --! If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with 
00122       --! the produced data.
00123    slone_i   : in  std_logic; --! Stand-alone mode
00124 
00125       --! No NanoFIP status transmission
00126       --! If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with 
00127       --! the produced data.
00128    nostat_i  : in  std_logic; --! No NanoFIP status transmission
00129 
00130 
00131 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00132 --  Connections to internal logic
00133 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00134       --! When high, will refresh settings_model/const_id within two clock cycles
00135    req_id    : in  std_logic; --! Request generation of Model and Constructor ID
00136 
00137       --! Bit rate. 
00138       --! Straight copy of input pins (allows for further treatment if needed).
00139    settings_rate : out std_logic_vector (1 downto 0); --! Bit rate
00140 
00141       --! Subscriber number. Station address.
00142       --! Straight copy of input pins (allows for further treatment if needed).
00143    settings_subs : out  std_logic_vector (7 downto 0); --! Subscriber number
00144    
00145       --! Model Identification. First byte. Second byte is not settable.
00146       --! Used for production of Identification Variable (10xyh).
00147    settings_model_id: out std_logic_vector (7 downto 0);  --! Model identification  
00148 
00149       --! Constructor Identification. Second byte. First byte is not settable.
00150       --! Used for production of Identification Variable (10xyh).
00151    settings_const_id: out std_logic_vector (7 downto 0);  --! Constructor identification  
00152 
00153       --! Produced variable data length, based on p3_lgth_i and nostat_i
00154       --! inputs. \n
00155       --! Outputs the number of data bytes, including the NanoFIP status and
00156       --! the MPS Status and can be used as the second byte sent and for
00157       --! variable length counting purposes.    \n <tt>
00158       --! p3_lgth          nostat=0  nostat=1   \n
00159       --! 000: 2 Bytes   =>   4          3      \n
00160       --! 001: 8 Bytes   =>  10          9      \n
00161       --! 010: 16 Bytes  =>  18         17      \n
00162       --! 011: 32 Bytes  =>  34         33      \n
00163       --! 100: 64 Bytes  =>  66         65      \n
00164       --! 101: 124 Bytes => 126        125      \n
00165       --! 110: reserved  => 126        125  do not use - mapped onto 101 \n
00166       --! 111: reserved  => 126        125  do not use - mapped onto 111 \n </tt>
00167       --! Note: when SLONE=Vcc, p3_lgth_i should be set to 000.
00168    settings_p3_lgth: out std_logic_vector (7 downto 0); --! # of bytes incl status
00169 
00170       --! Stand-alone mode.
00171       --! If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with 
00172       --! the produced data.\n
00173       --! Straight copy of input pin (allows for further treatment if needed).
00174    settings_slone : out std_logic; --! Stand-alone mode
00175 
00176       --! No NanoFIP status transmission when 1.
00177       --! Straight copy of input pin (allows for further treatment if needed).\n
00178    settings_nostat  : out std_logic --! No NanoFIP status transmission
00179 );
00180 
00181 end entity settings;
00182 
00183 
00184 
00185 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00186 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00187 -- COMPONENT DECLARATIONS
00188 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00189 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00190 
00191 --=============================================================================
00192 --=============================================================================
00193 --! Architecture of settings
00194 --=============================================================================
00195 --=============================================================================
00196 
00197 architecture rtl of settings is
00198 
00199    type      t_id_state is (IDLE, GET_ODD, PREP, GET_EVEN); --! Type for state
00200    attribute ENUM_ENCODING : STRING;                        --! define values
00201    attribute ENUM_ENCODING of t_id_state : type is "00 01 11 10"; --! gray code
00202 
00203    signal    s_id_state    : t_id_state;  --! current state
00204 
00205 begin
00206 
00207 --=============================================================================
00208 -- Concurrent signal assignments
00209 --=============================================================================
00210    -- slone, rate, nostat are just copies to allow further treatment in this 
00211    -- module if needed.
00212    settings_rate   <= rate;
00213    settings_subs   <= subs_i;
00214    settings_slone  <= slone_i;
00215    settings_nostat <= nostat_i; 
00216 
00217    -- settings_p3_lgth combinatorially generated out of p3_lgth_i & no_stat_i
00218    -- These signals come directly from input pins.
00219    -- Outputs the number of data bytes, including the NanoFIP status and
00220    -- the MPS Status.
00221    with (p3_lgth_i & no_stat_i) select
00222       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(  4, 8)) when "000" & '0', 
00223       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(  3, 8)) when "000" & '1', 
00224       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned( 10, 8)) when "001" & '0', 
00225       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(  9, 8)) when "001" & '1', 
00226       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned( 18, 8)) when "010" & '0', 
00227       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned( 17, 8)) when "010" & '1', 
00228       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned( 34, 8)) when "011" & '0', 
00229       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned( 33, 8)) when "011" & '1', 
00230       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned( 66, 8)) when "100" & '0', 
00231       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned( 65, 8)) when "100" & '1', 
00232       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(126, 8)) when "101" & '0', 
00233       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(125, 8)) when "101" & '1', 
00234       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(126, 8)) when "110" & '0', 
00235       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(125, 8)) when "110" & '1', 
00236       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(126, 8)) when "111" & '0', 
00237       settings_p3_lgth <= std_logic_vector(to_unsigned(125, 8)) when "111" & '1'; 
00238 
00239 
00240 
00241 
00242 --=============================================================================
00243 -- Processes
00244 --=============================================================================
00245 --! State machine to retrieve the full ID codes.
00246 --! Samples the model/constant id settings inputs only when requested by req_id.
00247 --! This way the s_id_o outputs stay fixed and give less noise.
00248 --! Takes 4 clock cycles to have the settings available.
00249 p_id_FSM_state: process(clk)
00250 begin
00251 if (clk'event and clk='1') then
00252    -- no reset needed, machine will always return to its idle state anyway
00253    case s_id_state is
00254       when IDLE     =>
00255          if req_id = '1' then s_id_state <= GET_ODD  -- wait for req
00256                          else s_id_state <= IDLE;
00257          end if;
00258          -- settings_model_id and settings_const_id keep old value. 
00259          -- A register is induced.
00260          -- Do not sample continuously to have a more quieter design.
00261 
00262 
00263       when GET_ODD  =>   s_id_state <= PREP; -- grab value for odd bits when 
00264          settings_model_id(1) <= m_id_i(0);  -- going to the PREP state.
00265          settings_model_id(3) <= m_id_i(1);
00266          settings_model_id(5) <= m_id_i(2);
00267          settings_model_id(7) <= m_id_i(3);
00268 
00269          settings_const_id(1) <= c_id_i(0);
00270          settings_const_id(3) <= c_id_i(1);
00271          settings_const_id(5) <= c_id_i(2);
00272          settings_const_id(7) <= c_id_i(3);
00273 
00274 
00275       when PREP     =>   s_id_state <= GET_EVEN;
00276          -- settings_model_id and settings_const_id keep old value. 
00277          -- have this idle state to allow the inputs to settle.
00278          -- Tcko+Tsu, go through I/O buffers and external jumpers.
00279 
00280 
00281       when GET_EVEN =>
00282          if req_id = '0' then s_id_state <= IDLE; -- wait until req gone
00283                          else s_id_state <= GET_EVEN;
00284          end if;
00285          settings_model_id(0) <= m_id_i(0);  -- if req_id stays, continuously
00286          settings_model_id(2) <= m_id_i(1);  -- samples the even bits.
00287          settings_model_id(4) <= m_id_i(2);
00288          settings_model_id(6) <= m_id_i(3);
00289 
00290          settings_const_id(0) <= c_id_i(0);
00291          settings_const_id(2) <= c_id_i(1);
00292          settings_const_id(4) <= c_id_i(2);
00293          settings_const_id(6) <= c_id_i(3);
00294    end case
00295 end if; -- clk
00296 end process p_id_FSM_state;
00297 
00298 
00299 --! Generate outputs that select which bits are sampled.
00300 --! When s_id_o(0)==0, the odd bits are sampled.
00301 --! When s_id_o(1)==0, the even bits are sampled.
00302 p_id_FSM_output: process (s_id_state)
00303 begin
00304    case s_id_state is
00305       when IDLE     => s_id_o <= "10";  -- does not induce a register:
00306       when GET_ODD  => s_id_o <= "10";  --  s_id_o(0)=     s_id_state(0)
00307       when PREP     => s_id_o <= "01";  --  s_id_o(1)= not s_id_state(0)
00308       when GET_EVEN => s_id_o <= "01";
00309    end case;
00310 end process p_id_FSM_output;
00311 
00312 
00313 
00314 end architecture rtl;
00315 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00316 --                          E N D   O F   F I L E
00317 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
